elements.title: Rockwood & Company shipping department fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1919 Rockwood & Company shipping department fire (location pictured) in New York City led to a flood of chocolate and butter sufficient to "float a rowboat for two blocks along Flushing Avenue"?

elements.title: Henry Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Henry Jackson served for 44 days, the shortest tenure of any New Zealand member of parliament?

elements.title: armored mud balls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that armored mud balls are formed underwater when fragments of clay or mud are rolled by moving currents, picking up a coating of gravel or pebbles that helps to stop them breaking down further?

elements.title: Eliane Capobianco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eliane Capobianco's election to the Bolivian Constituent Assembly reflected the propensity of the country's agribusiness elites to occupy positions that granted them influence over land reform policy?

elements.title: Angelina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Dylan rhymes "Angelina" with "concertina", "hyena", "subpoena", "Argentina" and "arena"?

elements.title: The Exposé (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Exposé's false claims that COVID-19 was created by Moderna were republished by Chinese state media outlets?

elements.title: Maewa Kaihau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New Zealand composer Maewa Kaihau sold her rights to the song "Now is the Hour" for £10, a decade before it became a hit in the United Kingdom and United States?

elements.title: Blue Ridge Sanatorium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Blue Ridge Sanatorium was once a prizewinning pig farm?
